question:
With reference to the launch of Mo Sarkar program by the Odisha government, consider the following statements:
  1. It involves a citizen-centric feedback system.
  2. The initiative is to be applied only to the health department.
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
explanation: Â Statement 1 is correct: The Mo Sarkar is an initiative by the Odisha government in line with the 5-T program- transparency, teamwork, technology and time lead to transformation. The initiative involves a citizen centric feedback system. It is to be launched on occasion of Gandhi Jayanti this year. Statement 2 is incorrect: The initiative is applicable to two departments: health and police. The citizens will be able to register their complaints to a database without the possibility of non-cognizance of complaints. The initiative is mainly aimed at transforming police stations to make it more citizen-friendly.
